page.title: 02LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: runs between the canal and the dis- mantled railway line. At the bottom of the long hill, the railway line originally bridged the road to then run parallel with the canal. The village of Poulshot, mentioned in the first Domesday Book, lies to the west of the main road on the lower land around Devizes. The principal feature of the village is the large green, on which cricket is regularly played against other clubs on a league basis. Although primarily agricultural, other businesses include a private building firm and a small micro- electronics firm.
